1.text: Dear valued customer, We have identified a potential security threat to your account. Please verify your account information by clicking on the following link to avoid any potential damage to your account.
1.explanation: This email is a phishing email because it is coming from a suspicious email address at 'privacy-protection.net' and is trying to create a sense of urgency to trick the recipient into clicking on the link and giving away their personal information. It is important to note that scammers often use fake email addresses and URLs that are similar to legitimate ones, so it is crucial to verify the authenticity of the email before taking any action.

1.text: Greetings [Name], We regret to inform you that your account has been compromised. Please click the link below to verify your identity and secure your account.
1.explanation: This email is a phishing email because it is trying to create a sense of urgency to trick the recipient into clicking on the link and giving away their personal information. It is important to note that scammers often use tactics like this to get people to act quickly without thinking, so it is crucial to verify the authenticity of the email before taking any action.

1.text: Dear [Name], Please be advised that your account has been locked due to suspicious activity. To unlock your account, please click the link below and follow the instructions. If you did not initiate this action, please contact our support team immediately.
1.explanation: This email is likely not a phishing email because it is notifying the recipient of suspicious activity and providing a way to resolve the issue by clicking on a link or contacting the support team. However, it is still important to exercise caution and verify the authenticity of the email before taking any action.

1.text: Dear [Name], Your account password will expire in 2 days. To update your password, please click the link below and follow the instructions. If you have already updated your password, please ignore this message. Thank you.
1.explanation: This email is likely not a phishing email because it is a legitimate notification about a password expiration and provides a way for the recipient to update their password by clicking on a link. However, it is still important to exercise caution and verify the authenticity of the email before taking any action.

1.text: Dear [Name], As part of our ongoing security efforts, we will be performing system maintenance on our servers. During this time, you may experience intermittent service disruptions. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. Thank you for your patience.
1.explanation: This email is likely not a phishing email because it is a legitimate notification about system maintenance and provides information about possible service disruptions. However, it is still important to exercise caution and verify the authenticity of the email before taking any action.

1.text: Hi [Name],We recently detected some unusual activity on your Google account and wanted to confirm that it was you. If you did not log in from a new device, please let us know so we can take appropriate action to protect your account. If it was you, please ignore this email.Best regards,The Google Security Team
1.explanation: This email is likely not a phishing email because it is coming from a legitimate email address at 'google.com' and providing information about unusual activity on the recipient's account. The email also includes instructions for the recipient to take appropriate action to protect their account. However, it is still important to exercise caution and verify the authenticity of the email before taking any action.
